name: Holiday Inn Waikiki Beachcomber Resort Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Waikiki Beachcomber from April 7 to 10. The rate was $169.00 per night. This was our third stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in a prime location right across the street from the Pink Palace and just a short walk to the beach. We had an ocean view room looking at Diamond Head. One of the good things about staying here is the proximity to the market right next door. This time one of the bad things was the proximity to the market right next door. A new bar, Coconut Willey's, opend in the marketplace and the first night a band played until 1:30am. Very hard to sleep.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Size

reviews.text: In the morning my wife asked for another room and the hotel was most gracious in moving us to the other side of the hotel and the following nights were just fine.
reviews.title: Clean Rooms & Friendly Staff...but that's it!

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice at letting you check out but come back and take a shower around dinner time if you are getting a plane late at night.
reviews.title: Loved the Beachcomber

likes.disliked: — At the time I stayed here there was construction going on next door.

reviews.title: ANNUAL VISITOR
reviews.text: Overall this is a good hotel for the price and I would recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for $92 a night which was a steal in June! This hotel is a basic 3-star hotel... not fancy or anything since it was built probably in the 60's but we didn't have any problems when we got there. We checked in early and our room was already available. We were on our honeymoon and left valuables in the room when we left so just left the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the room so we didn't have to worry about housekeeping or anything. This hotel is super close to shopping and Waikiki Beach is only a couple blocks away. Don't know if I would stay there again but for the price we got, it was a great deal!
reviews.title: Not bad for the price
Like it!
reviews.text: Having visited The Beachcomber five times in the last ten years we must say that it is great place. ON Kalakua 2 minutes from waikiki and a few minutes from "Perrys". a good eating place.
Combine this with the "International market" this a favourite place in the islands for us. We usually go there every second year the other year we go to Royal Lahaina on MAUI.
reviews.title: decent, clean, central, and good parking for $137 after taxes.
Wonderful vacation on Oahu staying in Waikiki Beach at Waikiki Beachcomber
reviews.text: The only thing that we have had to ask for has been an steaming Iron. However the friendly girl who cleand our room fixed that right away!

reviews.title: Loved the Beachcomber
reviews.text: what you expect from a $137 room. Kitty-corner to Moana Surfrider (have breakfast and Tea on their Veranda!) with decent views from the higher rooms. No frills here, just a spacious, basic room that is very clean. good beds, carpet in good condition, nothing standing out as Dated.

We just stayed at the Beachcomber for five days. The location was great. The ocean is just across the street, surrounded by shops and places to eat. The staff was friendly. A good place for drinks is across the street at Dukes. Drinks are reasonable for Hawaii and the ocean view is wonderful. Definately would recommend the Hawaiian Adventures tour - Boogie boarding, snorkeling and hiking. They will pick you up right from the hotel. Request "D" and Joe as the tour guides. Down to Hawaiian natives with a great sense of humor. My only complaint about the Beachcomber is that THE BEDS ARE SO HARD. I read other reviews and heard the same thing but I didn't think it was going to be a big deal. By the second day my back was killing me. I had to ask for an extra pillow so I could put it under my back while I slept! Otherwise I was a great value!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This property is now a part of the Ohana and Outrigger family of hotels. This is initially why I booked with them. However, they overbooked the property when I got there and would only accomodate me in a smoking environment. This surprised me since Ohana has some completely non smoking properties. I thought they were updating their standards. The folks at the front desk were very poor on listening to our needs and were extremely uncooperative. I finally got the attention of a young gentleman (Alex) to see the obvious which is just to find me a comparable room with their other properties. It was so easy but the other women at the front desk were horrible on helping anyone and even one tried to be confrontational. I accepted a reservation at the Ohana East, just around the corner. Read my review and see my photos from that stay.
reviews.title: Poor Service -- Relocated to Ohana East

reviews.text: This hotel was conveniently located, though not on the beach. However..it was in need of some updates and doesn't have a very welcoming atmosphere. But I would start with the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: For the price we paid, it was an excellent choice. We had an ocean view room on the 14th floor, which is non-smoking, just over the market place. Yes there was noise in the evening but nothing you couldn't shut out with the patio door closed--it was just music anyway.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The spa did work, never had to wait for an elevator, and the rooms were clean, even tho a bit older looking.The staff was always friendly and yes the breakfast is a bit over priced--the Ohana East had a great breakfast in a nice setting.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time ......the staff were super and we were right in the middle of everything . The rooms are big and the staff are very friendly . We will go back next year and stay here again .Beautiful hotel !!
reviews.title: had a great time

reviews.text: Our family experience at this hotel was very pleasant. We were there for 4 nights and the accommodations was excellent. The rooms were newly renovated, so it was clean. I am usually picky in where I stay, but I can honestly say that the overall the rooms were spacious enough for a family of four. They gave us a newspaper everyday. Towels were given everyday even though there was a sign to conserve towels, put them on the rack. They still gave us fresh towels.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do have a parking lot that charges $18 a day and we were able to find a parking spot everytime we came back to the hotel. However, you don't need to drive if you are around Waikiki. Everything is walking distance or you can ride the trolley for free with your room key.
reviews.title: Had a great time at Pro Bowl

likes.disliked: — Not much offered at the Hotel as far as activities.

reviews.text: The hotel is located central to Waikiki. Macys was just downstairs from the hotel. The International Marketplace was on the side of the hotel. Shopping was so easy to access. The beach was across the street. It was a great location! My family would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: it's...okay

likes.disliked: — everything else...I just didn't feel like I was on vacation.

reviews.text: Great location, we were right there during the block party for the Pro Bowl, and that place cranks, if your going to Hawaii and you have the stamina for partying go during the Pro Bowl, stay at the O'Hana Beachcomber Waikiki, it's convenient, it's right there in the middle of all the action. For breakfast, lunch and dinner I would go elsewhere, the hotel is pretty expensive, and doesn't offer much. There are all the cool stores right there and real cool Footlocker across the street, Waikiki Beach is amazing, simply amazing. The Duke Kamanakuku statue has a live web cam, so you can call all your friends and show off where you are. The hotel was great, the staff was ... ok and nice, not real helpful but nice people, they all are. Like I said great location and had an awesome time, It was a Christmas gift from wife, my Anniversary, the Pro Bowl, Valantines Day, in Hawaii all rolled into one, Yeah Im fat and happy NOW!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise at this hotel was awful. At the END of the hall, we could still hear the elevator - PING!!! which was annoying... You could hear everything taking place in the adjacent rooms (and I do mean everything). We got the feeling of safety since you have to scan a key card to get up to the room floors in the elevator, but it was no so - we had our hotel room door kicked in by someone in the middle of the day (we weren't there at the time). We were moved to another room. The hotel staff referred to this as "the incident". The Internet was pricey (15 cents per minute, 35 cents per printed page). Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville is right down stairs which was fun, though loud, even from our room 16 floors up!
reviews.title: Unsettling experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my wife and I flew from Brazil to Japan at the beginning of our vacation in April 2008, we knew that due to the length of the trip and also due to the crossing of the dateline, we would arrive in Japan two calendar days later and we planned for it. Call me stupid as much as you like, but I did not realize that we would go back a calendar day as we crossed back the dateline from Japan into Hawaii, as we did. So as we arrived at Honolulu airport, we had a connection to Kauai and hotel reservations FOR THE NEXT DAY! But we absolutely loved to gain an extra vacation day, absolutely free. And instead of changing our flight to Kauai, we decided to take it as it came, and stay in Honolulu for what we called our Groundhog Day. I would eventually come back to Honolulu at the end of our trip, but we were going to steer away from Waikiki. As we now needed to make a quick decision, for the first and only time in my life I booked a hotel calling from a toll-free phone at the airport. I ended up at this Waikiki Beachcomber, which was very nice because they gave us a huge room for a decent price. We then went for our Waikiki experience, which basically came down to chilling at the beach, watching the sunset and going to a restaurant. As I walked back to the hotel from Diamond Head after the sunset, I stopped at a public restroom and I came very close to being mugged by two weird-looking guys. If I had stayed thirty seconds longer in the restroom, something definitely would have happened.
reviews.title: My own Groundhog Day

reviews.text: To make a long story short: I ended up in Waikiki by chance, had a very nice time, went to the beach, loved my day in Waikiki, but when I eventually return to Honolulu I'll make the same decision I made the first time around: stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.title: Great staff couldn't make up for the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to check in at the Beachcomber on our first night, service we received was very good, took a little while to find our booking coz we got transferred over, we got allocated room 216, we were very happy with our room, 2 queen sized beds, nice and spacious a bit of noise coz we were so close to the lifts but you kind of got used to it after a while.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won this trip through a radio station, and was very excited to travel to Hawaii for my first time. Upon arrival, I was told they did not have the ocean view room that I was promised and had just confirmed the day before. However, since they could not give the me the upgrade to a partial ocean view and just charge me the the standard room rate since I won the trip, they comped up through their buffet breakfast during our stay, and paid for our parking! We were more than happy with this compensation, and ended up getting our ocean view room anyway the next day! The rooms are outdated and a little crusty, but the location and service was great! Highly recommend if staying on a budget.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We went back to the Beachcomber. We had just been there in April and decided to stay there again. The rooms are clean and basic but who is going to Waikiki to hang out in their room. Last time we went we stayed in a standard room that was on the nosier side of the hotel. This time we were directly across from our old rooms and it was very quite at night.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time and the Beachcomber is in a great spot in Waikiki

Short walk by the Pink Hotel and you are at the beach. Pleanty of ABC stores and restaurants. They Hyatt down the street has the best breakfast buffet. The Beachcombers is ok but I would recommend atleast going to the Hyatts once. Cheeseburger in Paradise is also wonderful with the open air and across from the beach.

reviews.text: We enjoyed strolling Kalakaua at night and watching some of the street shows. If you go and Basketball Man is there - watch his show. He is wonderful and included our 10 year old daughter in his act. He gets the best crowds and does a great "family show" that is funny. The kids kept asking to go see him everynight.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, if we go back to Waikiki we would like to try something different hotel wise but if the Beachcombers prices are right we would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Beachcomber, having been there once before 4 years ago. All the negative reviews made us very nervous, but this really is a decent & clean hotel. Keep in mind it is only a 3-star - so don't expect brand new bathrooms, luxurious linen, fancy fittings. We are very much 5-star snob wanna-be's, so we miss all these fineries, but in Waikiki where even this 3-star hotel costs $180p/night, let's not be fussy.
reviews.title: Look, it's still a really good 3-star hotel

reviews.text: We "toured" four different rooms on this stay, thanks to the wonderful front desk, who let us choose & change rooms, then upgraded us just because we thought our "ocean view" was too "partial ocean view" and was close to the elevator noise. All the rooms seemed identical, all clean, tastefully decorated, no mold or disrepair, and no "eiiiuw" factor that I am quick to find in less-than-5-star hotels. The hotel's website photos are a very accurate representation of the rooms. We are VERY FUSSY and think this hotel is very good for a 3-star.
reviews.title: Great value in great location
Read this before you go!
reviews.text: To address some previous reviews: Front desk service - yes we have had one or two grumpy people, especially on the phone. Tip - call back later and talk to someone else and/or make sure you approach a smiley, happy-looking person on the desk - there's usually at least three front desk staff to choose from. We found all bellboys/maintenance people to be very nice & very helpful.

Type of room: Okay lets be frank, there is no "ocean view" from this hotel - it is always only a partial glimpse through the buildings in front of it. But it's a fair comment and strategy to always pay for the higher-priced room & view, as perhaps these rooms are kept in better condition. Non-smoking rooms seem to be in better condition too.
reviews.title: Seemed perfectly fine to me
The worst hotel in waikiki
reviews.text: Noise: There is an AWFUL lot of construction going on in Waikiki - the entire Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre is being renovated (about 10 Waikiki hotels surround this area) so there is a lot of construction noise. In addition to this, the entire city block across from Fort DeRussy Park is being rebuilt, so almost every hotel directly in the main Waikiki area is affected by noise. It looks like this construction will be going on for another 6-12 months. The sliding door does a good job of blocking out the noise, but if you want your door open a lot or the maximum quiet, choose a 'partial ocean view' room and ask for the Diamond Head side of the building. Any hotel more towards the Diamond Head side of Waikiki Beach will be quieter than hotels closer to Fort DeRussy Park. We did also hear a lot of "fan" noise from all sides of the building that seems to travel up from the large air-conditioning plants on top of the lower buildings, but we just closed the door when we wanted peace.

Let me start with the good: Waikiki, location location location. Although it is not located oceanfront it is across the street from the beach and conveniently located in downtown shopping district. Front desk staffs were extremely friendly and attentive to guests needs. Although the parking garage is usually packed by non-hotel guests the contracted parking attendants are attentive to ensuring that all vehicles are parked. Unfortunately for myself and the ten day stay there were way too many negatives. The elevators (four of them) were entirely insufficient for the volume of guests. Wait times for elevators exceeded 5 minutes throughout the day. To add to the already outrageous delays the hotel shuts down two of the elevators during their Polynesian Magic to allow access and from the lobby to the street level. The physical building itself is under construction and the sound of jackhammers and constant construction takes away from the Hawaiian relaxed feeling. At night the noise continues as the Bar located in the international village thumps its music into the wee morning hours. Don’t let their advertisement of broadband and wireless internet fool you. Their internet is normally not working or inadequate for email. If you’re looking for a relaxing hotel in Waikiki avoid this one.
reviews.title: Loud, Lacking in many areas...AVOID

reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days and found it to be great value. We were on the 15 floor and had a great ocean view. The room had an iron and ironing board, a blow drier and a fridge. The beach is just across the street and the international market was next door. This hotel is in the middle of the hotel zone and within walking distance of most of the great restaurants. Our favorites: Keos(Thai), Tikis, Arancia (on beachwalk, Italian). The weather was disappointing as it was cloudy and rained every day but There was lots to do even in the rain.
reviews.title: great location great view

reviews.text: Location: A wonderful location, the hotel sits on the main street with plenty of shopping (LV, Prada, Gucci, Tiffany, etc.) and the open air International Market where you can shop till you drop, eat and bars with no cover charge. The Beachcomber sits right across the street from the lovely beach. The Aquarium and Zoo is a short 15 minute walk from the hotel. The transit system is good, costing $2.00 with one free transfer.
reviews.title: Great Location
Great Location!
reviews.text: Hotel Service: I found the staff to be very friendly. There is a pool, hot tub and outside covered cafe that is open from 6:00am - 1:00pm. The housekeeping I found to be unacceptable because for the seven nights I was there, they never once gave us clean coffee cups or drinking glasses. And don't epect to get any because they aren't kept on the cleaning cart. Instead, they wash out your coffee cup each morning with water from the sink, if you are even lucky. Makes me wonder if they were even sanatized after the guest in the room before us. I requested clean cups in the morning but never got them. There was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, coffee and coffee pot in the room.

reviews.title: Great Location ,great service
reviews.text: Excursions/Day Trips: I found Mary Ann at the first section of the trip desk to be very friendly and very helpful. We bought our excursions from there. You will find many vendors on the street selling trips but I found more security purchasing them from the vendor in the hotel so it was worth the cost. The day trip around the island was wonderful, as was Pearl Harbor and whale watching. There is a wonderful Blue Hawaii Show featuring a wonderful Elvis impersenator that is sure to please everyone. There are four beautiful ladies in the show for the men's viewing pleasure too. As of then, Don Ho was having shows on Thur. and Sunday nights only. I didn't make it to that.

All in all, the location of the hotel was excellent though to get a good view, you will need to be on the 19th floor or higher and rooms 1906 - 1909 to get a good view. I was in a smoking room but found no odor of smoke (I do not smoke).
reviews.title: Great location!
Good Value...Great Location.
reviews.text: Overall I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Of course it's hard not to have a great time when you're in Hawaii. The location of the hotel could not have been more perfect. A lot of hotels in the Waikiki area claim to be close to the beach, but are actually blocks away. This hotel really is directly across the street. It's right across from the Royal Hawaiian (Honolulu's famous "Pink Palace of the Pacific). It took us less than 10 minutes from our 20th floor hotel room to be out basking on the beach. I would say that this hotel's #1 attribute is where it's located. It's also right next door to the International Marketplace and it's pretty much right in the middle of Waikiki so it's easy to walk everywhere rather than take a bus or cab. The 2nd best thing about this hotel was the service we received. The hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. Every single hotel employee we dealt with greeted us warmly and went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. They were also very helpful about giving us tips on things to do/places to eat, etc in Waikiki. The 3rd best thing about the hotel is that all the rooms (at least as far as I know) have their own balcony, and at least two-thirds of the hotel rooms have a partial-ocean-view. Upon check-in, we were actually given 1-time entry keys and allowed to view a few different rooms on our own so we were able to pick which room we wanted. Here's what I didn't particularly care for. When I'm on vacation, I don't spend much time in the hotel, so I'm usually not too picky. I just like things to be clean and well-maintained. This hotel is definitely in need of a major renovation. It's somewhat outdated and the rooms appear somewhat worn. There were some stains in the carpet and the rooms just have an overall appearance of needing some love. The maids did a very good job of cleaning our room and re-stocking used items without us having to ask. But, you can only do so much with an old worn-down room. However, we were told by a couple of staff members that by this time next year, all the rooms will have undergone a complete renovation. Another minor quibble I have was the water pressure. The last time I had such weak shower pressure was in India...really, no joke.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Beachcomber 01/30 to 02/13 and couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel. The rooms look exactly like the online pictures. Really clean and spacious. We had a King room which is larger than the Queen rooms. Originally had a standard room (no complaints) but decided to upgrade half way thru the trip to an ocean view which was fabulous. Well worth the upgrade money.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel!!

reviews.text: The service at this hotel was outstanding. From the Bell service, Maintenance (had a problem with sliding door, brought it to the attention of the front desk girls and by the time breakfast was over it had been taken care of. Same when I blew a fuse with the blowdryer. Fixed within the hour. Awesome) and Housekeeping staff .Speaking of the front desk, these girls were always pleasant and personable and helpful. The pool is great. It gets sun from about 9:30 am til 5:30 pm and there are tables and chairs as well as plenty of loungers for sun bathing as well as full food and beverage service provided by Jimmy Buffets at the Beachcomber. This restaurant opened during our stay and is alot of fun. The buffet breakfast was excellent and included coffee. A great deal. Had breakfast , lunch and dinner there as well as many drinks and was all good. The decor in the restaurant is unbelievable. You have to see it to believe it ! They have live music outside in the early evening and then again later in the evening inside. The location of this hotel can't be beat. Take the escalater down to street level, cross at the crossing and take the beach access next to Cheeseburger in Paradise to the beach. If you make the light it will probably take about 3 minutes. I highly recommend staying here!!
reviews.title: Quiet & comfortable, just what we were looking for !

reviews.text: I was a bit concerned about three females travelling alone, my mom is 70 & daughter is 15-- I called the hotel prior to our arrival to ask them about the safety and security of guests in their hotel --ofcourse they reassured me but I was still a bit worried. I have to admit that they were right--I had nothing to worry about. We felt pretty safe and secure throughout our stay. Our rooms were comfortable & the flat screen TV was an extra bonus. The staff at the front desk were always helpful when I needed directions or assistance. The BC Hotel location is perfect -- everything is conveniently located around it. A very special thank you (Mahalo) to Sami for going out of our way to ensure that our stay was enjoyable. I forgot my cell charger in the hotel which she promptly tracked down, letting me know that it is on it's way back !
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel in Waikiki!
My new favorite in Waikiki
reviews.text: Just got through staying at the Beachcomber for over a week stay. I have stayed with some of the chains on the beach for 3 - 4 times the price and paid a fortune for dining on top of the price for our hotel stay. Price aside, the rooms were very nice, newly redone and clean - they even have flat screen TV's and refridge's. I stayed on the 14th floor and had a beautiful view of the beach even though the hotel is on Kalakaua

ave (only a short walk to the beach). I loved walking to the beach during the day and then being located in the heart of Waikiki for ton's of shopping and dining. This area has really changed, it is very nice. During our stay the new Jimmy Buffett's at the Beachcomber restaurant opened, we went for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. The food and service was great and it was a very affordable place to eat. I loved the burgers, my colleague liked the fresh fish with good looking veggies and island rice. One night we stayed up and danced to the band - Kaulia Bay Brothers...they were awesome! Beachcomber we will be back.

reviews.text: If you are looking for a nice, clean, centrally-located, and reasonably -priced hotel, then the Waikiki Beachcomber is for you.

reviews.title: Decent accomodations in a great location
reviews.text: We have just spent 5 nights at the Ohana Waikiki Beachcomber. We loved this hotel, its so centrally located if you want to be in the heart of the shopping. Its right next door to the International Market Place, which is a great place to pick up souvenirs and has a great eatery with lots of Asian foods to choose from. The hotel is approx 5 mins walk to the beach and a 15 minute trolley ride to Aloa Moana Shopping Centre. The rooms are clean and in good condition. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a partial ocean view room. The rooms were quiet and we didnt hear noise from any other guests. The pool was clean, only small, but there was hardly anyone there on the days we used it. Rooms are air-conditioned and have a small fridge, hairdryer, cable Tv and inroom safe. Bathrooms are small, but who spends time in the bathroom when you are in Hawaii! Parking is available, but costs US $15.00 per day, which I thought was abit expensive, but there is a parking station in the next street which is cheaper. The in room safe costs US $3.50 per day to use, again I thought that was abit over priced. Overall we loved this hotel and would stay there again, the only thing I would do different is ask for a room on the Diamond Head side of the hotel, as we stayed on the other side and the garbage truck woke us up early most days as it came along the lane way.

aka: Holiday Inn Waikiki Beachcomber Hotel Honolulu
description: The Holiday Inn Waikiki Beachcomber Resort is a 496-room hotel conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki, next to the International Market Place, just 300 steps to world famous Waikiki Beach. It is home to the Magic of Polynesia show, the one and only Jimmy Buffett's Restaurant & Bar, Honolulu Surfing Museum and Macy's Waikiki department store.
